Introduction.title: Java Introduction
Introduction.body:
Q: What is Java?
Ans: Java is a high-level, object-oriented, platform-independent programming language which achieves platform independence using bytecode and JVM.
• Here high level means the language which is easy to read and write also hide hardware level details

Q: What is the difference between JDK, JRE, and JVM?
Ans:
• JDK: JDK is a complete package required to develop Java applications. Where a JDK contains below items.
• JRE: Environment for running applications (includes libraries and JVM).
• JVM: JVM is a virtual machine like minicomputer that executes Java bytecode then JVM use interpreter to execute bytecode line by line to machine code. Before that compiler convert source code to bytecode.

Q: What is a compiler and an interpreter?
Ans: The compiler converts Java source code into bytecode also A compiler translates the entire code at once (faster execution), Interpreter executes bytecode line by line also interpreter translates line-by-line (easier debugging). Java uses a compiler to create bytecode and the JVM to interpret/compile it at runtime.

Q: Is the JIT compiler different from the regular compiler?
Ans: Yes. The regular compiler (javac) creates bytecode before execution. The Just-In-Time (JIT) compiler converts bytecode to native machine code during runtime to improve performance.

Q: Explain Java's platform independence.
Ans: Java compiles source code into platform-neutral bytecode (.class files). Any system with a JVM can execute this bytecode, regardless of the underlying hardware or OS.

Q: What is bytecode in Java?
Ans: Bytecode is a machine-independent instruction set contained in .class files. It serves as the intermediate step between Java source code and machine-specific code, executed only by the JVM.

Q: OOPS concepts?
Ans
• Encapsulation :Imagine you have a Diary with a lock on it.
• Inheritance :Imagine a Super-Class called Phone. All phones can make calls
• Polymorphism :Polymorphism is a big word that just means Many Shapes.
• Abstraction :When you want a cup of coffe from a vending machine, you just press the button that says Cocoa.

Interview Questions.title: Java — Interview Questions
Interview Questions.body:
Q: What is JVM?
A: JVM executes bytecode and provides platform independence.
